name: Quiet Waters Park
address: 600 Quiet Waters Park Rd, Annapolis, MD 21403, USA
reviews: Gorgeous Public Park!  This is a beautiful slice of heaven.  A hidden gem, kinda.  Winter, early Spring skating rink.  6 plus miles of trailes, dog beach, and views of the Chesapeake Bay, South River and Harness creek.  You can rent bicycles, kayaks, etc in the warmer weather.  Our little divine hideaway.

Great picnic areas with nice scenic views to the bay at the end of the trail. I loved the paved roads, the large green fields, playground, and the outdoor ice skating rink in the winter. I can’t wait for my future visit in the spring and early summer season :).

This was the #1 park I wanted to visit on our trip to Annapolis. We got here much later than we wanted and only had about 25 minutes before the park closed (8:30pm on a Wednesday in August, closes at dusk) so we just drive around for 15 minutes or so and I got some pictures. We did not have to pay to enter/for parking since the gatehouse was closed. Usually it is $6 to enter the park. This park has some beautiful views and great opportunity for photos. It has several hiking trails, picnic areas, dog park, dog beach, boat launch, boat rental, streams, ponds, compost area, playgrounds, a ton of parking, pavilions, a visitor center/gardens/blue heron center, gazebo, 3 separate restrooms, etc. The park is very clean. We saw some people walking and running at night. The best part about this park is all the deer we saw! We saw over 40 deer (bucks, does, and fawn) randomly driving through the park. I love animals so this was a treat. We would have loved to get here early and walk around. If we are back in Annapolis again in the future, we will spend more time here.

Excellent work from Anne Arundel count services. The place is expansive with room to play, hike, and roam. I recently visited in winter to take kids to their outdoor ice rink and it was great for us, with little crowd.

What a great county park. Trails everywhere, different waterfront areas, boats/kayaks in the summer, ice skating in the winter, a playground, multiple picnic areas. Easy to spend an hour or all day here...plenty for the whole family and for any occasion.

name: Hammond-Harwood House
reviews: The house is an excellent example of Georgian architexture.  The tour was well worth it and Don was an amazing docent!
Awesome building and tour.
Thoroughly enjoyed the 12th Night concert.
Great historical home in Annapolis. Recommend taking a tour if in the area. Wonderful colonial kitchen representation and beautiful rooms throughout.  Highly recommend.
Great spot to get historical understanding of Annapolis

name: Annapolis City Dock
reviews: Lots to do. An east walking,  small historic city. Tour the dock, the Naval Academy and all of the beautiful colonial neighborhoods.  Great restaurants, ice cream shops, coffee cafes.
We had a blast here! Our waiter was awesome and the food was good! We were having such a good time that I forgot to take a photo of our food

If you go during a weekday it's not as crowded. If you can find parking near the dock, its 2hr parking. I parked in the Calvert Street Garage and walked around the area and it's gorgeous. The architecture is beautiful and  there are many historical sites. Incredible shops and restaurants.

We visited Annapolis several times while we were in Md over summer. The city dock was amazing! My kids and I found a really nice street tour, some ice cream, and shopping. There was a naval ceremony going on, so there were alot of sailors just out and about. Must visit town!
Fantastic city-town! Lots of great restaurants, bars, and shops. Awesome for a Sunday afternoon stroll with family or a night out with friends.

name: US Naval Academy Museum
reviews:
A must visit! Large campus, lush green. Young marines running on tracks and practising on the grounds truly adds to the punch and a feel to do something incredible! 

Do carry your ID cards and just walk in on a Saturday morning. You are booked for the rest of the day! Have lunch at any of lovely restaurants along the water body at Annapolis, walk around and have fun.

The Naval Academy Museum was very cool.  It was packed full of historical items and displays.  The pictures and videos and displays were very informative. It was a good time. I recommend it to people visiting the area.

I love this part of the academy. The bone ship section is my favorite part. Amazingly detailed models made from bone fragments; Chicken, pork, beef, whatever the sailors had that night. Really cool to look at and the details are amazing. There is so much to see it will take you a long time, even if you are not a usual museum person.
It’s hard to describe the magnificence of this place. Spend a few hours on a nice day to explore. It’s incredible.

Small intimate museum. Free to the public but you need id to enter the campus. Great, well documented exhibits. Don't miss the models upstairs which will be more interesting for younger kids. If you are a war buff, you will really enjoy this.

name: Maryland World War II Memorial
address: 1920 Governor Ritchie Hwy, Annapolis, MD 21409, USA
reviews: Gorgeous spot and setup, wish it had more attention than it gets, I would love to see it one more time before I leave. Just beautiful
Very nice memorial. Overlooks the Severn River, over to the Naval Academy. You will need a few minutes to enjoy it all.
A very beautiful view and nice memorial.  Nice place to just sit and relax.
It is such beautiful spot to stop and reflected, what has been gained and what was has been given. We love it so much. I got engaged here! 10.30.19
Beautiful memorial with views of the Severn River, Naval Academy. Naval Academy Briddge , Jonas Green Park and The Capitol in Downtown Annapolis

name: Annapolis Maritime Museum & Park
reviews: Friendly staff here. Told us some interesting stories about the ships back then. And it's free.

Very nice museum and venue for events. I often attend their concert series on Thursday nights during the summer. Great view of the Chesapeake Bay. Easy to pull into by boat and enjoy the music on the water.
Amazing place! Great for kids and "old kids" young at heart.
Museum officially closed till April for renovation.. But still nice place to hangout

even on an Overcast Day,
the view😍never ever gets old.
Vixi Libet Moriar
"I have lived, and I shall die, free"
Yes I have and will.

Save The Bay, please.
✌️💜

name: William Paca House & Garden
address: 186 Prince George St, Annapolis, MD 21401, USA
reviews: Nice garden and pond. Small bridge looks so cute. May be it can be good place for parti and marriage. Didn’t go inside the building but it must be nice inside. There is some trees which look like Christmas trees.

Words can scarcely express the amazing experience we had for our daughter's Sept 2019 wedding! From the very first planning-meeting (many months ahead) through the "recovery" days after the wedding, Jody Dalton provided expert, thoughtful guidance and assistance on everything! This was our first wedding (oldest child), so we were very intimidated at first. However, Jody is such a seasoned PRO that we opted to NOT hire a Wedding Planner/Coordinator-- because Jody's involvement was so comprehensive and on-point. (TIP: Book Jody AND any of the Catering companies on her "preferred" list {we booked Ken's Creative Kitchen for ours}-- and you get the combined coordination between TWO key players (the Venue and the Caterer), working in concert. ) No detail was overlooked. At the event itself, Jody served as behind-the-scenes "quarterback," directing all the actions of her staff and the catering staff to make ours a flawless, casual and comfortable evening for all 140 guests-- and 100% worry-free for the bride and groom! Jody also helped us (Mom and Dad) personally-- throughout the evening-- with helpful, unobtrusive, "gentle" reminders along the way to keep us on-track for accomplishing all elements of the reception (toasts, cake-cutting, etc.) without ever feeling rushed. The venue itself is hands-down the most beautiful, perfectly-sized spot for a true Historic Annapolis wedding! You cannot take a bad photo anywhere in the place! When it was all over, we almost wanted to do it all over AGAIN, just work with Jody some more :-) If you're set on having an Annapolis wedding, we cannot IMAGINE a better, easier, more cost-effective, or more wonderful spot and support team than Wm. Paca House and Jody Dalton. | Lastly-- Brides: go talk with Jody just once-- even if you don't end up booking the Paca House, you'll be glad you met her!

We did enjoy our visit to the garden, however for $5, I did expect to see a bit healthier looking of a garden. I understand it's the heat of the Summer, and there were still plenty of pretty plants and fruits to look at, but some plants looked a bit dry. We did not tour the house and this review strictly pertains the garden.

William Paca was a signer of the Declaration of Independence. The Paca House through Historic Annapolis offers fun and creative events all year long. The Gardens are gorgeous in the Spring and Summer and the Open House in December gives glimpses into Christmas during colonial times. 🎀🎄🎀

We didn't get to tour the William Paca House itself - you have to go on a tour, which have limited availability and are offered at specific times - albeit worth checking out before you go and planning around.  I do look forward to visiting one day!  We did walk the two acre eighteenth century style garden, which had several garden "rooms", a pond, a "folly" type building and a bridge.  All in all a great place for photo ops (and instagram posts)!

name: Banneker-Douglass Museum
reviews: Wonderfully kept and inviting museum.  Detailed explanations of the clear and accessible exhibits.  Two current art shows available on separate floors in a portion of the museum.  Very knowledgeable and hospitable attendant at the front desk.  Very kind and personable, as well.

This Museum is absolutely beautiful. Educational and a great vessel to obtain information on Slavery and it's impact on the City of Annapolis. This museum has been an Aid in educating my nieces and nephews on African American culture. They have also participated in many events at the Banneker Douglass Museum. 
#AriseaboveitALL.
The museum is beautiful and the guided tour was amazing! A group of mostly 5-10 year olds listened intently. I highly recommend visiting this treasure.
The staff was very friendly. They gave detailed history of the building and told wonderful historical stories about the area as well. I went on educational tour. Next time I'll be bringing my family.
Fantastic experience! Even better staff! I encourage all to go. Makes for a lovely weeknd visit for the family!

name: EscapeTime Escape Rooms
reviews: It was awesome! Me and my friend made a pretty last minute plan to do a room and it was ready when we got there! We went into “Revenge of Atlantis” and you’re immediately immersed into it. The hints we were given were clear, the clues to find were well thought through and we had a blast attempting to figure it out! The room was perfectly decorated and you truly felt like you were in the situation. The room was very clean and the staff were absolutely amazing and very friendly. I would definitely recommend going here!

Excellent and fun filled adventures.

We arrived on time, filled out our waivers, loaded the lockers and headed to our room.

The room went off without a hitch. You have to remember that you get four free clues and that each one street that will cost you a minute if your time. Lucky for us we didn't need to use the extra time and escaped with plenty of time left over.

If you're in Annapolis and looking for a nice place to escape from (just down the road from the prison aka ultimate escape room) then stop by. Lots of parking available.

We would definitely recommend Escape Time in Annapolis. We have done many escape rooms from all over. I have to say this one we had the most fun in.  It's good family fun. It will teach you to work together as a family or co worker's. Awesome time

Mary and Julie were wonderfully friendly and made the experience very welcoming. Dr. Mad’s was an intricate room with loads of fun challenges and puzzles to solve. 10/10 recommend for a great night out to have an exciting adventure.

I recommend EscapeTime Escape Rooms in Annapolis, Maryland.

We had a corporate team-building outing for our DC Region Sales Team. Our large group was separated into smaller teams and we used multiple rooms that started at the same time. Very Competitive! One of the best experiences ever! 

I will bring my family back to experience the fun, solve the clues, and “escape” one of the wonderfully designed rooms!

name: St. Mary's Church
address: 109 Duke of Gloucester St, Annapolis, MD 21401, USA
reviews: My wife and I spent a weekend in Annapolis in December 2019 to see the Christmas Lights Parade.  We attended mass at St. Mary's Parish that Sunday.  The church was  gorgeous and even more beautiful because it was decorated for Christmas. The Cantor sang beautifully.  It was wonderful.  We will definitely visit again.
My first-time in a catholic church & mass. Beautiful sanctuary & friendly staff.
Beautiful church.. Mass is amazing
Pretty church . Good service/mass this Sunday
Great church. You have to see the ceiling and how it was painted, wonderful!!

name: Pirate Adventures on the Chesapeake
reviews: This is a hidden jewel in Annapolis. My son has a diagnosis of Autism and they made him feel so special on our journey. We went for mother's day when they had an incredible deal: all moms were free. We took a boat ride, shot water cannons at bad pirates trying to steal our loot, and then we drank grog (root beer). The children each received a bag of loot to take home. A fun time for all!

It's pretty decent. Naturally geared toward kids. They do offer birthday party packages. The building itself is large. The boat docks on the other side of the parking lot so it's a short walk. Parking is very very limited (down side) There is shaded areas on the boat which is great. Every part of the boat is fenced / shielded off for kids protection. I would personally like the music to be a tad louder, I think that would have kept them more engaged. The two man crew on ship did a good job trying to keep the kids entertained.
Fantastic time. The entire Sea Gypsy crew did a great job. They keep the kids engaged and are sensitive to each child's needs. A great time for all!

The staff is amazing and quite hilarious not only for the kids but still. The kids were very entertained the whole time. I would recommend this to anyone with kids looking to have a good time in the area.

Great adventure. The kids enjoy it and the parents too! Great views on the water and the staff is very entertaining. They are acting as pirates but their hospitality, kindness, and dedication to the children is very real. Thanks for a great time!

name: Armel-Leftwich Visitor Center
address: 52 King George St, Annapolis, MD 21402, USA
reviews: Low key but very informative on a beautiful campus. On a sunny day take the time to walk along the riverfront.
One of the nicest  museums  I have ever been in,so easy to view  the exhibition

I had an awesome experience at the US Naval Academy Visitor Center, gift shop and grounds when I visited Annapolis recently. They have a very informative video about the most recent class and I am glad I watched it. I did not have time for a formal tour so I toured some of the grounds. I saw a wedding party come out of the chapel which was touching and memorable.

The gift shop is a must see and has some great items. The view of the United States Sailboat Show from the Naval Academy grounds is also a must see. Highly recommend this and thank you for your service to our country!
Great place , loved to see my grandson graduate and now we have one more , he has two more years to go.

If my parents had brought me here as a high school junior, I would have competed for a position here.  I was pretty hot stuff back then, but I would have been swept away by the challenge, prestige, and honor of the Naval Academy. 

This visitor's center would have been the gangway to that indoctrination. The exhibits are enticing, the staff friendly, and the daily pomp and circumstance of life at the Academy does just what it's designed to do: intrigue the nation's most promising to answer the call to duty.

So I wish I'd come here earlier.

name: Visit Annapolis & Anne Arundel County
reviews: Water tour was nice. A nice small town with lots interesting stuff to see. Enjoyed the seafood as well at buddy's.

My wife and I visited Annapolis for a weekend in December 2019.  We stopped by the Visitor Center early on Saturday morning to see if they had information on the sites.  We were greeted warmly by one of the staff members who gave us an information book and gave us suggestions about what to see that day.  Her suggestions and the book were very helpful in helping us plan our weekend.  I recommend a quick stop at the Visitor Center to anyone visiting Annapolis.
Best place to get information about Annapolis. Janet, one of the crew members helped me and gave lot of information on the places to visit in the area. Very friendly and helpful. Very clean place.
Everyone in here is very helpful. Their knowledge of the Annapolis area is fantastic. Even if you've been to Annapolis before, stop in here to find those out of the way places to see.

Good place to start your visit to Annapolis.  They have three stations that are staffed, and each staff member is knowledgeable about the area.  All the recommendations that we received very good.  If you plan on walking around Annapolis the parking garage beside their offices are the best place to park.

name: Great Frogs Winery
address: 3218 Harness Creek Rd, Annapolis, MD 21403, USA
reviews: Been wine club members for almost a year and a half. The club is great. No membership fees, 4, 6, or 12 wines a quarter. Free release parties with tastings, food and music. Couldn't ask for much more. The wines are excellent. Very flavor forward. A good variety of dry and sweet wines. A little something for everyone. Finally to the staff. They are awesome. Worked with Ben and Kelly most of the time and they will do anything and everything to make sure you have a good time. I'm pretty sure we will be wine club members for life at this rate. I would highly recommend this place and would give it more that 5 stars if possible. Dog friendly if you are wondering.

Greeted as we entered and we were seated.

Ben was friendly, very helpful and very knowledgeable about the wines they served us.  

A little pricey but good.

Visited Great Frogs while I was visiting Annapolis, it’s about 10 minutes from the town center via car. Went to taste their wines, but was told we weren’t allowed to do a tasting as it’s by reservation only and they were fully booked. This is somewhat unusual for a winery (or brewery) as more times than not they offer flights for you to purchase and sample their offerings right from the source before committing to a full bottle or glass. 

I was disappointed with my experience. I wasn’t able to see any wine making facilities on site besides the vines which seem quite young to produce grapes, if you’re interested in learning how wine is made I’d give this one a miss as all you’re allowed access to is a bar. We were told they have another facility on the eastern shore which is probably where the actual wine is made.
Meritage was pricey but delicious!

My wife and I were up from Florida celebrating our 13th wedding anniversary and one of our stops was Great Frogs Winery for a wine tasting.  When you first drive up to the winery you're greeted with actual vineyards, which may sound obvious but we've been to wine tastings with no vineyards in sight.  The setting was quaint and romantic, a place where the locals seem to hang out and enjoy some great wine.  As we were seated, we are served a mini palette cleansing charcuterie board and a basket with 6 different wines for the tasting.  Ben (the brother of the owner of Great Frogs) then came over and started us on our adventure in wine tasting.  His unique descriptions of each of the wines, food pairing, and the overall conversation were the most memorable.  Since we were celebrating our wedding anniversary they sent us off with a special gift!  Thank you for the great memory, we hope to be back one day.

name: St. Anne's Parish
address: 199 Duke of Gloucester St, Annapolis, MD 21401, USA
reviews:
Loves the Welcome sign! All visitors Welcome,  Parishioners Expected. 

Beautiful historic building.

Beautiful church.  Very nice people offering a lot of outreach services on Mon 6-8 and Wed 2-4.
Food pantry. BGE cutoffs. Evictions. I only took the 5th star away because it took forever to figure where to go in.

Annapolis is a wonderful quaint little town where you can step back in time.  There are many old houses and Annapolis was the capital of the US for a while.  George Washington resigned his post as Commander in chief after 8 years of service.

This large Episcopal church sits in the center of Annapolis ("Ann's City) in the middle of a pair of Colonial-era traffic circles/piazzas. Next to the church is the Maryland State House. 

Notable in the church are the twelve stained glass windows. After entering the nave, the he first window to the left (back of church) honors an early rector (head pastor), Mr. Southgate, after whom is named a neighboring residential street.

This is an active place of worship. While it is most heavily used on Sundays, visitors may encounter religious activities at various hours of the day throughout the week. Note that the space is used for quiet prayer and meditation by all. It's wise to maintain relative quiet while visiting unless on an organized tour of the space.
This church which is a historical building is in a circle. The area is neat, nice & quiet. The people are friendly, helpful & beautiful. I also love the landscape & architecture.

name: Kunta Kinte-Alex Haley Memorial
reviews: Timeless place of history that everyone would attend
Nice memorial/sculptures located right by Main Street and the city docks of Annapolis. The location of the memorial is beautiful. Located in the heart of Annapolis.

This guy plagiarized Roots from an author named Harold Courlander and his book The African, gotten taken to court in 1977 and loss. They gave him a statue and Pulitzer for a story he stole/made up. Lionizing an author for a piece of work that was plagiarized is an insult to real scholars/scholarship, truth, and history.
Very beautiful
Nice sculptures in a beautiful location by the town docks.

name: Annapolis Tours by Watermark
reviews: We did the walking tour of Annapolis with mistress Kate. Kate was very knowledgeable and interesting and enjoy the tour tremendously. Would highly recommend

My sister and I went on a walking tour with Jamie Foster (Mistress Marian) as our guide. I have lived in the Annapolis area since I was a toddler, and am very familiar with downtown Annapolis. It was nice to be a tourist for a change. We walked down some streets I don't normally go down on my visits so it was nice to see buildings and places I wasn't very familiar with, or haven't payed much attention too, and understand their history better. My 16 year old sister also learned a lot, and was able to fill out several pages of notes in a notebook she carried with her (she is currently writing a comic that is a locally based historical fiction, and has been taking great interest in learning about as much local history and folklore as she can). Our guide was very knowledgeable about the local history, and how different things tied together. She was also kept the child who was on the tour very engaged, interacting with him and having him help her show and introduce things. The groups are not very large so you never feel lost in a crowd. I don't recall any steep hills, just one thing of steps to the state building. Frequent stops, and benches to sit if needed. Many of the stops are under trees too, which is nice for shade (or in our case a very light drizzle that came and went a few times). You leave from the visitor center and end at the dock, ego alley, which is the heart of the town (it also has public bathrooms,  a info booth, and other amenities if needed) so that you can finish off enjoying the best of downtown Annapolis, a place you now have a better understanding and appreciation for.

We did the lighthouse tour on lady Sarah and Bryan and Maria we’re both so nice and helpful and welcoming we just loved them! We loved this cruise and they made it so much fun! Bryan was there to take pictures for us and answer any questions we had about the ship and the area, he was SO KNOWLEDGEABLE! Maria made some incredible and delicious drinks and was just such a people person and knew the ships so well, she told us the best place to sit, we will definitely be back and we hope they are on our next cruise! Thank you Brian and Maria!
We did the ghost walk with Mistress Mary and loved it. Very entertaining and full of rich history. Mistress Mary made the whole experience very delightful.
Great family tour with interesting narration. They also have a bar!

name: Historic Annapolis, Inc.
reviews: Beautiful place full of history and on the water.
An amazing place to go to see awesome sites. For a vacation like spring breaks or summer. Really cool 👏🏻
A wonderful organization that helps preserve our 400-year-old city. It’s home and we love every brick.
Quaint unique shopping and historic . Good food too
Beautiful small town

name: Charles Carroll House
address: 107 Duke of Gloucester St, Annapolis, MD 21401, USA
reviews: Really beautiful inside. Felt honored to be able to walk around the house freely that one of signers of the Declaration if Independence lived in
This house is an important piece of American History.
Just walked past... We were escaping the flood at the city dock.

The Georgian home of the historic Carroll Family. Acquired by Charles Carroll the Settler. If you study the foundations you will see the progression of additions to the house as the family grew in number, wealth, and prominence during the early history of English settlement in North America. Inside, the lower level of the house has some rooms with exposed walls and ceilings. You can view the building methods and tool marks on the massive timbers lumbered on the property to construct the home and enhance it from 1701 through 1856. Charles Carroll of Carrollton (in Annapolis we call him “the Signer”) the Settler’s grandson, was the only Catholic signer of the Declaration of Independence and survived longer than any other. Visit Historic Annapolis’ website for more details. Visit Annapolis to walk through history. 

Annapolis welcomes visitors. Please remember, only bridges and boats honk. Drive gently, patiently, and politely through our colonial streets. They were built for horses.
Such a great place of history and so nice to see it preserved!

name: Jonas and Anne Catharine Green Park
address: 2001 Baltimore Annapolis Blvd, Annapolis, MD 21409, USA
reviews: What can I tell you about Jonas and Anne Green Park?  Great place for anybody who loves being outside.  There are benches for those who want to relax and watch the afternoon sunsets over the Severn. There is a small beach area to enjoy feeling the sand at your feet. There is a fishing pier to cast a line or two.  For runners (or cyclists) like myself it is great starting point for your challenging weekly runs (rides) over the Naval Academy bridge and into downtown Annapolis.   There is a small kayak rental booth though I've not checked it out YET! The park is managed by MD Park Service Resources and there is a manned facility during normal business hours as well as clean restrooms.

If you haven't so far, you need to come here. It is beautiful and Unique. And the best part: There are great fishing spots here. So if you are into fishing try you luck here. Maybe a strong bite will make your day.

Lovely little park with sand or rock edged water. Fisherman love the pier. It's got sunny and shaded spaces with randomly placed picnic tables. Looks like there are kayaks for rent occasionally although I've never seen it open. To the south is USNA and to the north is the Rt 50 bridge. There's a nice little area to walk in the sand, or on the other side, fish from the rocks. It's open dawn to dusk. Definitely a great green space for public enjoyment.
A pleasant, well-kept park, great for watching sunsets on the Severn River

Really chill spot. Mini beach, and a few nice fishing spots.  A really awesome place to bring the entire family, for a cookout and some fishing, or just a nice solo adventure.  Great spot to get some really amazing sunrise and/or sunset photos!

name: Chase Home
reviews: Unique, functioning home of Samuel Chase, 1774 Maryland Representative and signer of Declaration of Independence. Beautiful gardens and love the large elegant double staircase with windows to 2nd floor. A real treat!
Very disappointed. Walked half a mile yesterday (Tuesday) in Maryland heat and humidity with two young grandchildren, only to find at 3:00   pm that it was arbitrarily closed. Call before going.
An absolutely beautiful historical home
Very very nice.
Was not happy about the tour guide.

name: The Chesapeake Children's Museum
reviews: In the past 5 years or so I've taken several groups of Juniors to complete a Girl Scout Journey-in-a-Day at the Chesapeake Children's Museum. The girls always have a great time working together during a workdays' worth of programming. The CCM has all the supplies and fun props necessary to make the journey both educational, thought-provoking and fun. The leaders of the journey events usually have a background in both Girl Scouts and education. The CCM is an excellent option for Girl Scout troop leaders and girls!

We went for the first time on Friday for story time. My 9, 7, and 3yo loved it so much that they asked to go back again that afternoon, once we had finished running errands. We went back again today (Tuesday) for a few more hours. Three times in a week and I still had to drag them out of there.
I agree with the reviewers who say that the toys are older, but that doesn't make them less fun to play with. There is so much room for imagination in this space and the rooms are set up for free play - kids can choose whatever role they would like and make the space their own. My kids especially like the art area, with a variety of papers, stickers, envelopes, cutting tools, etc. to choose from and the theater with dozens of costumes, wigs, shoes, and masks!

We’ve been going here on a membership since last summer. I really love the idea, and the guy at the front desk is always so nice. But I’ve seen the cleanliness go down hill and last time it smelled unpleasant downstairs so we didn’t even play down there. But I think this would be more successful if they did a big spring clean-out. It is just piles of stuff.

What a great place for kids! It's way worth the value, there's so much for kids to do here, from blocks and duplos, to animals, to exploring art or the dentist office or the supermarket. It may seem random and a little out of the way, but that's just part of it's quirks. If you bring your kids here, be prepared to spend a couple hours cause they'll have such much fun playing.
Very nice Kwanzaa overview for kids! Lots of great kids activities!

name: Historic London Town & Gardens
reviews: Just the perfect place for a wedding! The site is well manicured, historically accurate and waterfront views, spectacular. I’ve been to their garden sale when plants are divided and have bought some of the very best native trees/shrubs and plants, ever. Come early because there’s always a long line for great prices. It is  also terrific for kids - a great learning experience - and pets, friendly and warmly received. Go, spend the day and have a picnic.

Just left a Wedding Open House. Gorgeous venue for a wedding. You have the water, the gardens and a taste of history all in one setting. Beautiful views. Large grounds that are well maintained. You cannot go wrong!
Loved the history & the well preserved condition of the buildings.  Off season so no crowds. The historical placards were concise & yet informative as well as easy to read & understand.
Imaginative play, creative learning and nature exploration all make for a great educational experience.  Yeah, London Town.
Neat little hidden spot. Was here for a tour as part of a convention group. Interesting display of history combined with a botanical garden. Some impressive redwoods!

name: Crypt of John Paul Jones
reviews: Perfect example of the Russian-American part of history.

I am not sure the stars really matter here -- the whole campus was amazing, and the crypt was an interesting part of the naval history there. John Paul Jones was a fascinating character whose remains were relocated to the crypt below the cathedral. The tomb is ornate, marble with dolphins, and JPJ's history can be found on the walls encircling it. Worth visiting if you enjoy random historical tidbits!
Attention to detail is amazing. What a great opportunity to honor the first Navy officer in the US's brand new Navy. We loved the breadth of information included.

The crypt is amazing.  The fine workmanship and attention to detail is phenomenal.  A must see if your visiting the campus.  This is my third visit to it.  Use to have a honor hard.  But our leadership deemed it unnecessary.  For some reason traditions seem just to be fading away.
Well worth the trip. Seeing the crypt of a Revolutionary hero was very special

name: Truxtun Park
reviews: This place lies in the heart of annapolis but is often overlooked or driven past. It has some trails that lead to the pool and the boat ramp. The facility itself is fantastic. Has many options for workouts. Classes are offered. Area for kids to play. I worked for truxton for about 7 or 8 years and I can confidently say I had some of the best times of my life there
Family fun! Great place to spend the day!
My go to place to think and have peace. Very tranquil.

A great trail and park. The trail section goes thru a well-shaded woodsy trail that is both close to the water, as well as in the middle of the woods. Some sections have a few short and steep inclines as well as roots protruding from the ground. But suitable for beginners.

I'm a bird watcher, and this park is quite close to my home. I've recorded about 70 different species here, which is OK for such a small park.
It's seldom crowded, and the people you meet tend to be nice.
It could use some minor maintenance now, but my request to have a tree removed from the path last year was handled quickly.

name: Susan Campbell Park
reviews: We came to Annapolis from Baltimore to sightsee and have a date night. Susan Campbell Park is located in the heart of Annapolis. We went to one of the restaurants and then walked to the docks and on Main Street to checkout some stores. The park/city docks have benches to sit on. There are newspaper machines too. Cobblestone walkway creates part of the historic feel but beware you can trip easily since it is not flat/even and some of them are coming up. There are bathrooms and showers for boaters nearby. They have parking but it can be a bit tight – some of it is free while others are metered. We hung out a while just looking at the water and people-watching. Great area for people watching if you are into that. We did not partake in getting the famous ice cream nearby (Storm Brothers) since we were still full from dinner but it is a popular place. The Naval Academy is nearby as well if you want to visit that but check the times. It is very beautiful at the docks/park. Main Street has a ton of different restaurants, dessert/ice cream shops, services like real estate, shopping such as spices, clothing, books, Maryland souvenirs, beach themed items, gifts, and specialty shops. I would definitely recommend going to the park/city dock and main street. It is great if you are by yourself, with friends or family, or a date night.

Absolute perfect place to watch the sunrise. You'll often see students from St. Johns, people in photo clubs, and other photographers. Myself included. I wouldn't suggest taking food if you want peace though. Plenty of the local DTA ducks will aggressively approach you for a bite or two, or everything you have! Literally there's no "ducking" them within that twenty five yard perimeter. I'd stick to coffee or tea. 
You can see from time to time; boats docked from all over the world. Including New Zealand. Not often are there people passed out, whether homeless, or just sleeping off the excessive drinking. 
All depending on when you visit, you might be fortunate enough to catch members of our local Naval Academy as they're initiated.
Keep your eye's peeled for huge blue heron that often hang out around the docks before sun breaks. Lighting is good and there's usually joggers passing through, or crabbers on the opposite side of the docks "chicken necking" and occasionally that cute couple experiencing their first or one of many Annapolis City sunrises... It's certainly a must do if you're in town.
Really like this area/park! Great place to sit and look out at (the activity on) the bay. Very spacious as well. Make sure to stop by here if you're strolling through Annapolis!
Lovely place , very quite , overlooking the river , you must visit it if you are visiting Baltimore
Outdoor concerts by the bay during the summer make this a very fun spot.

name: Thomas Point Park
address: 3890 Thomas Point Rd, Annapolis, MD 21403, USA
reviews:
Nice place to take a walk and see a nice sunset. There are two gates, so I don’t believe this would be a great place to watch a sunset. The opening hours are far past sunset and the gates will keep you from getting in to see the sunrise. There are many potholes on the road in, and it’s only a one-lane road, so definitely drive slow. There are a bunch of deer and many birds that live here, so there’s a strong chance you’ll see wildlife on your trip here. It’s a free park, so that’s also very nice. 

The lighthouse is a lot farther from the point than I thought it was, so it was a bit difficult to get a picture worth saving with my phone.

An historic Anne Arundel County park, it is part of Chesapeake Bay Heritage. Beautiful, natural scenery, with plenty of waterfowl and wildlife. Great for walking, picnicking, and fishing. Great longviews of the Thomas Point lighthouse and Chesapeake Bay Bridge. Be sure to read the rules online for going in & out of the park. Permits are required for some parts, except in winter. Also, be aware that there are numerous potholes on the clay/gravel road inside the park.

Excellent 270 degree view of the Chesapeake Bay South of the bay bridge.  My primary use is for Winter bird-watching, which can be excellent at times, but the warm weather fishing is very good.  (Permit required). There are a few picnic tables, port-a-johns, and a reservable  area for larger gatherings.
Good for fishing..not much else

The local guide is not correct about the park being free. During the warmer spring and summer there is a fee to get further back in the park.not so during the fall and winter months .Also I have been coming here for yrs and the scenery here including sunrise and sunset are spectacular.

name: Sandy Point State Park
address: 1100 E College Pkwy, Annapolis, MD 21409, USA
reviews: I was here for the 2020 MD Polar Bear Plunge. There wasn't much of a hassle with getting in even with so many people attending, volunteering, and working the event. The only downside was it didn't really seem like there was good signage with parking. We had to park in a particular lot but we had a hard time finding it. We drove around and then had to turn around to get to the correct one. Other than that, the event was awesome. It was my 2nd time doing the Polar Bear Plunge. I will definitely be going back.

**REVIEW FOR LIGHTS ON THE BAY!**
This light show is one of the nicest ones around, if not the best!
It's a very lengthy course. About a two mile drive along the Chesapeake Bay with approximately 70 animated and stationary displays illuminating the roadway.
Great place to bring the whole family for a fun-filled drive.
5 out of 5 stars!

A nice convenient beachy experience without having to cross the bay bridge and deal with weekend traffic and then a few more hours of driving to the ocean. 

They have a lot of picnic space, and ample space in general so even with a good amount of people there it’s still comfortable. 

I can’t imagine the water is the most clean, but it’s not noticeably unhealthy. 

Overall a good quick spot near DC to get away from the city for a few hours.
We enjoy Sandy Point. Since OC is few hours away this is a good  place for a day trip! Clean beaches, in-season refreshment stand, and even fishing. Fun family fun for the day!

This place is very dear to my heart. My family has been going here since I was a child and family event would take place there. Ppl normally complain about the jellyfish but I never had any problems with them. I enjoy being with my family here.

name: Paddle or Pedal
address: Quiet Waters Park, Annapolis, MD 21403, USA
reviews: Absolutely amazing a great family experience staff is super nice and helpful
Beautiful weather and very friendly people
Super nice staff they stayed open till 7 to let us get out on the water. Amazing place to kayak. Very well priced too!

A great way to spend an hour or two on the water at a reasonable price. I've rented paddleboards in. August 2018 and again in August 2019 when visiting family. They had great boards and the location is perfect for beginners too.
The staff are really helpful and they have great deals on gently used kayaks at the end of the season

name: Maryland Renaissance Festival
reviews: Always a good time! Festive, fun, music, food, crafts. Rain or shine, great family fun!

I have always loved the Renn Fest. I don't remember when it was @ Hopkins, back in the day, but I do remember Columbias Symphony Woods. I love the new location in Kingsville, it's darn near a perfect setting. Only down side is that the clientele is changing. Not so many people into the Renaissance theme anymore. A lot of Cosplay folks and younger kids there just to drink beer.

My opinion is unfairly biased.  I really enjoy Ren Tests.  I have been to several different ones in several different states.  That being said, I really enjoy going to the Maryland RenFest.  There are multiple shows going simultaneously, so there's always something to watch/do.  There are elephant, camel, and horse rides, which myself and all of my children have gone together.  My kids always have a great time.  It is a yearly tradition in my household to attend the RenFest, and I see no reason why that tradition will not continue into the future.
Just an awesome experience, helpful friendly players, lots to see, lots to eat, lots to do, come early stay late

Always love fair! Even more fun when you go dressed up! Great food and shows, unique goods for sale, fun for kids of all ages! Hit the ATM before you go, it sucks to have your fun held up by ATM lines. Also if you have a small child, bring an off-road stroller. Makes it much easier to get around and see all the merriment!

name: Chesapeake Bay Bridge
address: Chesapeake Bay Bridge, Annapolis, MD 21409, USA
reviews:
I received  a Citation Toll Violation for $56.00 dollars. Video Toll amount $6.00 and  penalty amount for $50.00... But that's just it. This is the first time I have received this bill and its from 9/28/2019. First notice includes 
a 50.00 fine. I called and spoke to customer service and the woman was very rude and kept talking over top of me,  stating I did receive another notice.  But in all honesty I have not and was not willing to help and make things right. I am a single parent and can not afford a 50.00 fine for a $6.00 toll.

How do I rate a bridge? Lol. I absolutely hated this thing the first time I drove over. Full blown panic attack!! But, if I want to visit my heavenly spot, the beach-I must go over it. Proud to say, that while I still get anxiety, I do it! Stay focused and don’t rush! 🏖

It's a fear buster if you r leary of heights.
Speed limit 40 mph it's all good. Enjoy the view!!  And fresh air.

Nerve wracking. Grip the wheel tight. Pray. Make sure if you have kids they don't distract. The first thing that crossed my mind was I paid 4 dollars to die. After. Sense of accomplishment and find another way back.

Eastbound: $4 cash for a car. As of this review, no construction. 

Westbound: Toll-free. Bridge deck is pretty bumpy based on where the road seam lies in relation to the striping (this is due to construction so hopefully temporary). Double yellow line is confusing when leftmost lane is open for same-direction traffic.

name: Ellen O. Moyer Nature Park
reviews: This is a nice little park and a rare public water-access site within Annapolis city limits. There are 2 parking areas connected by a nature trail through the woods. The smaller parking area is near the dock and boat launch ramp, & has just a few spaces. The other parking area is much bigger but further away. There are picnic tables and a water fountain, but no bathrooms, at the boat launch area. If there are bathrooms at the other end of the park, I didn't see them. The boat ramp is non-slip metal, so you won't get muddy launching a kayak here. The park is in the midst of several marinas full of very fancy and impressive yachts & sailboats, and near side creeks lined with beautiful waterfront homes to sight-see. Not much wildlife to see, other than ducks, as this is a very built-up area with a lot of human activity.

A very small park on Edgewood Road in Annapolis. Its high hill provides a good view, and proximity to the harbor provides habitat for many birds, which is my principal interest in this park. There's a few tables and I've never seen it crowded.
Great place for a girl Scout event.

We watched Passing Strings play there at the Maritime Museums event on Thursdays called Tides and Tunes. It's moved from their location in Eastport to this one. It's a more forest area but hey it's a really nice area and the audience was great.
Great evening at the Maritime Museum!

name: Downs Park
address: 8311 John Downs Loop, Pasadena, MD 21122, USA
reviews: Clean and well maintained with a paved 3.2 mile loop to jog. Beach and dog beach are fun, but people sometimes let their dogs off leash at the dog beach despite the signs warning. Burden rescue has a cool owl and there are lots of pokemon stops to enjoy, too.

Great park. Took my grandson for some hiking, geocaching and play time. Enjoyed the trails a great deal, and met a lot of friendly dogs and their owners. He met a friendly snake in the nature center, and there is a really fun magnet game of name that animal! Playground was fun, as were the health activities along the Eco Trail. The beach is nice, even in winter. the whole family would enjoy this park.

This park has everything a public park in Maryland should have. Beach view of the Chesapeake Bay including a view of the Bay Bridge. A fishing pier ( make sure you have your fishing license and saltwater stamp) for anglers to try their luck on. A dog/ pet beach to bring your pet to. Nature trails that are both scenic and exhilarating. A nature/information center about local wildlife that can be found locally. A garden that is perfect for quiet contemplation or a just leisurely walk. An out door concert and movie pavilion that operates during the warm months. In short this park has it all. Make sure to bring your military ID.

My favorite park! I have been going here for almost 25 years, and have fond memories being a kid and playing with my friends, riding bikes, flying kites, etc. here. My husband and I got our engagement photos taken here, and I now take my family and my dog, and am still creating memories! It is a lovely park with friendly staff.

Be aware of the front gate lady.  She would not let us drive in and get cash from a friend.  
Make sure you bring your six dollars cash.  
I would have thought a state park would show a little flexibility.

name: Lawyers Mall
reviews: Nice place to go for a walk on weekends.
Beautiful dedication to Thurgood Marshall.
Very inspiring. Also is maintained regularly.
Great place for a rally!
Where the action is,, where you will find the Governor . Where some of the Good laws are put in place for everyone, short or tall.

name: Mitchell Gallery at St. John’s College
reviews: What a great hidden gem. We have been going there for 30 yrs
Art gallery of St. John's College with shows that are of a caliber for university art museums of far larger size. Located within easy walking distance of the statehouse.
A jewel in our fair city and just celebrated it's 30 years of existing.  Worth you making it for a visit.
A good if very small art gallery. Don't plan your day around it, but it's a nice diversion.
Lovely show and gallery at a very unique college.

name: Severn River Bridge
reviews: Always pleasant to drive through, especially with the scenic view of the river.

It is a hugh, long, high and very beautiful bridge. It also appears like it is a new bridge. The ferry had more than enough space to pass through underneath. It goes higher and higher as it goes across the river. It also appears very strong with plenty of columns holding it in place to hold all the weight of all the vehicles travelling across. It is a fantastic piece of beauty and a magnificent construction across the Severn River.
It's just so beautiful,
It's kind of an appetizer before the Bay Bridge
Almost always a great view and lots if traffic.

name: Westfield Annapolis
reviews: Beautiful, Peaceful, Extra Clean, and quiet, very nice friendly people. My highlight was California Pizza Kitchen potato soup and chicken sandwich with 🧀. Fast service, food was extremely fresh, the staff, servers, and waiters were so kind in greeting and welcoming us, they didn't disappear, they checked on us with genuine concern. The ambiance was very inviting, so relaxing and welcoming. I like the design, layout, and decorum is fantastic! Come and see for yourself. I recommend the potato soup

One of the nicest malls in Maryland for sure. Food court could use a few more options but there's places to grab a bite throughout so it evens out. Lots of kid friendly stores and play areas, a video game lounge and a movie theater. Definitely a treat.
Nice place. Lots of good stores and the food court has lots of different varieties. Reminds me of some of the malls back home in California.

What a lovely place to shop!  I live in Texas, so it will be a long time before I make it to Maryland again, but I will remember my experience always.  If you are fortunate to live in Maryland, be sure to go by Westfield Annapolis!  You will not be disappointed!

Big mall, lots of stores, usually full of Midshipmen in uniforms or civies on the weekends.  Parking can be difficult at times.   I wouldn't recommend going to see Santa at this mall.  Its $44 for 3 digital images.  Its a long wait and they didn't even take three pictures.  You can buy a package in advance and schedule a time.  If you are looking for a good place to see Santa go to Bass Pro Shop, you don't have to buy a package in advance and don't have to wait in line.  You sign up to join the wait list, it gives you an approximate amount of time and then it texts you when its time. You have 30 minutes from the time they first text you to get there.  As a result you can sign up and go shopping at that store or other stores in the area.  After that its only like 5 minutes to see Santa and you get a free 4x6 image.  The digital copy is $15.

name: National Cryptologic Museum
address: 8290 Colony Seven Rd, Annapolis Junction, MD 20701, USA
reviews:
There is an unmistakable connection between the NSA and this museum. If you are anywhere near Ft. Mead this is a must see. 
The staff are very knowledgeable and helpful to visitors. They have free materials for both adults and children.
I would make it a point to visit their library to see their unique collection and possibly chat with the librarian 
The visit provides a unique glimpse I to the careers of men and women who assess the secrets in our nation's security. I thank them for their service.

Want to understand why we have and need the NSA?  This place explains the history and gives a lot of insight into the headlines (information warfare, hacking, information security) and some great insights into the future.  Allow a couple of hours, and get a tour from the docents--the exhibits are great, but the people take it next-level.

Really, really worth the trip. I know most people today think, uh a museum? How. Boring!....not here. There is so much history and intriguing aspects of espionage and technology it's simply over stimulating. They have areas for all ages. And they even have souvenirs for the kids, ladies and yes the guys.

A deceptively small museum. You can spend hours learning the history of the technology and the people involved with cryptology and cryptanalysis from their beginnings through today. Lots of hands-on exhibits for school-aged kids (and up :). Docent-led tours packed with information - call for timing. There is also an amazing library covering all topics in the field you are free to browse and read. A very well-curated and well done museum.

I loved this museum. Craig was amazing. Very helpful and knowledgeable. I really appreciate his time. The sweet lady working in the gift shop was great too. The amount of awesome information, artifacts, and everything they have here..... One of my favorites in the area. I am so glad that I was able to make it to visit. It's really great for those who are interested in intelligence and espionage and how our people are working to keep us safe. The library is...... amazing. So many good books.

name: Baltimore-Annapolis Trail Park
address: 51 W Earleigh Heights Rd, Severna Park, MD 21146, USA
reviews: It's a bike trail, not really sure what else to say. Usually pretty low maintained and not terribly dirty. Nice place to take a long walk for a good bike ride. Certain parts of it should definitely be avoided after dark.

Nice and long trail with beautiful natural view. See picture below what I captured last time. Clean and nice place to bicycling and walking. Trail so   easy crossing but some street road cross may disturb you. Bikers need to careful for local speed limit.  You can found clean restroom , information at park station. If you are planing to visit here  must try once !

It's an OK urban bike trail but I've been on much better even in and around cities such as Chicago. Maryland could step it up a bit. The section between Rt. 100 and BWI Airport can be sketchy. Lots of homeless and Rx addicts. There are times when it's bad enough I've turned around. Signage is confusing especially around BWI so plan your route before leaving if it's your first time. Observation area at BWI is nice. Rt. 450 and Annapolis bridge crossing can be hairy. Parts of the trail will need lots of replacing. Foliage overgrowth into trail makes for dangerous rides. Hey, it's Maryland. This is what you get.

The perfect amount of up hills and down hills to keep it interesting.  The path is in the process of being repaved and is on its last section.  Therefore it's like a new path. Really nice for biking or rollerblading.
The park ranger is very nice and informative. In my opinion this park would be fun for biking. The road is good and smooth. It's about 6 miles one way from Serverna Park to Annapolis.

name: Maryland State House
reviews: Cool historic spot. Very beautiful especially with the sunset in the background! There is also plenty to do around the state house including shopping.

Nice state house to visit. It has historical rooms and photos of past politians, a statue of George Washington in the back left room giving his resignation, and lots of pieces of text which give description of the items and photos in each room. Great place to come for a school field trip or with young children. 4 stars because there isn't a whole lot to see but it's still a really good place. FYI: make sure to bring your ID!
Amazing history, and an even more interesting circular road design.

I didn’t actually have time to explore the inside of the state house, but it sure was beautiful from the outside! I’m sure it’s just as pretty on the inside. I feel like it contributes perfectly to the aesthetic and culture of Annapolis. I’d certainly be interested in taking another trip back and exploring the inside, and learning some of the history surrounding the building!
Interesting historical capitol building. You have access on second floor and you can take pics. Free entrance and free tour. You need to have Id.

name: Towne Transport
reviews: Towne Transport provides the best view travelling around the area. The higher the better. You just can't miss anything. The bus is small and maneuvered the small streets easily. There're windows all around & offers a 360 degrees view.

Best way to get to know the town and its amazing history. My family and I had a great time!
Highly recommend it!
Love the history  provided while on the tour
Had a great ride. Got to see the town. Would highly recommend.

Mark was our guide.  Very informative.  Sparked my desire to return to area for a few days.   Had lunch at Chicks & Ruth's which was dinner style, noisey with great great food in huge portions at very reasonable prices.  Crab cakes to die for.   Visited 9/19/16
Not to crazy about pastrami.

name: National Aquarium
address: 501 E Pratt St, Baltimore, MD 21202, USA
reviews: Had a wonderful experience!  For father's day my wife got me the Aquarium Dive.  Took a little class for a certification.  Best part of the dive actually was walking through the Aquarium with my wet suit and gear.  It felt like the scene in "The Right Stuff"  everyone was staring and in awe of all us.  The dive itself is cool, not very big a much smaller area and tank.  They encouraged us to interact with the people that we looking in.  Since the fish are so used to people they would swim right up to you.  Very cool.  You can even pick up the sand and let it fall down to the ground and the fish would come up and lay underneath it.  I was told it was like a massage for them.  Anytime you did it, the fish would swarm to you.  My kids loved being able to see me in the tank.  It's not the biggest aquarium but lots to see and well done.  Great staff.  In a very popular area with lots of places to eat and check out.  I would highly recommend doing the dive or just visiting it.  You can't go wrong, for a fun and exciting day.

Great visit. Place was spotless even though we got there at sunset. Got to see every exhibit and enjoy our time there. The view of the harbor was really nice too even though it was cold outside. Nice to see they take pride in their Aquarium. I'd definitely come back next time we're in the area.

My trip was absolutely fantastic! All of the staff were very knowledgeable and helpful. The mystery animal was very interesting and I loved listening to the woman putting on the show. She would ask the group of kids in front of her if they had questions to engage them and keep them interested. When I was walking around the rainforest area the lady in there very nicely pointed out all of the animals and gave us a couple more facts about them. The area was also very clean and the animals all looked happy.

Absolutely LOVE the National Aquarium! Exhibits are well developed and the stacked, ascending layout of the aquarium with the amazing reef exhibit as it's anchor is a sight to behold. 
There are regularly scheduled daily animal encounters as well as an all day touch tank experience. Scattered stations for learning and interacting are spread throughout and really compliment the exhibits. 
Our entire family - from 8 to 40 yrs old - always has a great time!
We also enjoy the central Baltimore location which provides access to ample, affordable parking and many options for dining.

No matter if you live in Baltimore or are just visiting, definitely add the National Aquarium on your list to visit. We loved this place the first time we came. What a cool and fun experience!! The entire family was able to enjoy the Aquarium. There is a lot to see here, so if you're not able to devote an entire day, I highly recommend making time to come back. We asked for year passes for Christmas, so we're going to be regulars here. Very family friendly, no matter the age. 5 of 5 stars for sure.

name: Lake Waterford Park
reviews: This place is great. Recently updated and had lots of new things like a large swing that I can only describe was on a zip line, several slides, and an instrument area. There's also plenty of tables and benches for picnics and relaxing. Tennis and basketball courts. I was surprised that the bathroom was pretty clean too.

This park is beautiful there are some things to do there is a park for the kids and a lake to see the ducks and geese. You can fish or even hike the trails to see more wildlife. You can go and have a party or picnic with the family or friends. Great place to be outside. There are basketball courts, baseball field, football field and even a tennis court so much to do.

Wonderful park trails. Met a nice local lady and chatted. Great community, you can see it in the diversity of the playground. Large area. Would be cool to see what events take place here. Maybe a Medieval Fair.

It's a pretty decent park to take the kids to play, have a cookout or just shoot the breeze and walk the trails. For the most part the restrooms have been very clean any time I've visited. Great place to go play ball as well. Not sure if anyone has mentioned before but there are 3 pavilions you can rent for events or a special occasion. There's one large pavilion and two smaller ones. The large called Blue Jay is right by the playground. The two smaller ones the Goldfinch and Chickadee are side by side in the wooded area on the lake side of the park. I'll be having my baby shower here in June so I'll give an updated review then according to my experience. I'll be adding a few pics of the Chickadee pavilion below. I hate that they don't have photos of the pavilions for you to see before renting. So figured I'd help out. There are 8 tables and 3 grills to each small pavilion. When you go on there site they mislead you to think each small pavilion is only $100 to rent. However once you go to book that isn't the case. The Goldfinch is $100 to rent but the Chickadee is $160 to rent. Even though they are side by side the Chickadee costs more because it is considered to be the most private of the two. Although I feel this is bs it isn't my call so just that I'd add that.

A large wooded park with a number of playground structures for kids of all ages. Plenty of room to play, large fence around the playground. Nearby walking trails to the small man made lake provide young ones something to do. Highly recommend this park for families.

name: Pennsylvania Dutch Farmer's Market
address: 2472 Solomons Island Rd, Annapolis, MD 21401, USA
reviews:
We loooove this place! I’ve been coming here since I was a kid and it’s always the same which is great. I’ve never had a problem here for anything. The food is all freshly made. Prices are reasonable. We can’t leave without a soft pretzel or two. If you’ve never had one, stop what you’re doing and go get one!

Their store in the back is great with a lot of unique things for sale.

It’s not about what to get here. It’s about what not to get. Everything (and they have just about everything) is amazing. Personal highlights are the pretzel dogs, pot pies, fried chicken tenders, and the ice cream 

From baked goods to furniture. This is the spot. Gets very busy at lunch. Expect to wait. But the staff is so friendly you hardly notice

So much fresh and delicious produce and food! The cheeses are so good and affordable I don’t go anywhere else now! Would highly recommend stopping by and maybe grabbing a pastry! If it’s your first time I would ask one of the helpful people working there how check out works. I got a little confused my first time but they were so helpful and kind!

I want to like this market but too many cons for me.  First, the parking is woefully inadequate for the patrons.  It's difficult to find parking and others shops in that area compete for spaces as well.  Second, while there is a nice selection of vendors it's so darn crowded you have to decipher where the line ends vs crowd of people.  Good luck moving a cart around there.  Go early to try and beat the rush.  Also, trying to leave the shopping center can be a challenge.  Poorly designed traffic flow and exit.  It would be better if they had a larger space elsewhere with better parking, but that's just my opinion.

Awesome place to get anything from fresh meats, produce, preserves, and condiments to delicious cranberry bread, chocolates, breakfast, and sandwiches. The array of choices is darn near overwhelming! You have to pace yourself and know that you can always go back again. The lines can be wrapped around the store at lunchtime and on Saturdays but weekdays in the a.m. are pretty kosher. If you have not been, it is a must experience. With the amount of patrons that come to the market daily and the assortment of goods that can please most any palette, it is a win-win for the Pennsylvania Dutch Market and the community at-large. Oh, I almost forgot,  there is also the option to buy handmade furniture.  Did I say this is a five star establishment?!

name: Oriole Park at Camden Yards
address: 333 W Camden St, Baltimore, MD 21201, USA
reviews: Camden Yards is a cathedral of baseball compared to many of the newer parks that seemingly have constant distractions and alternative forms of entertainment. The park is striking beautiful, the seats are close to the field, and there really aren't any bad seats. Fans are attentive and knowledgeable, making it a great sports experience. There are some surprisingly good food options if you know where to look too.

Love coming here and bringing family from out of town to the games. We always have so much fun! It is such an awesome stadium and experience. We just moved here and my hubby already got season tickets.

This is one of the few ballparks in the nation that isn’t corporately owned. It’s a perfect location for a professional baseball game and a night out with family or friends. The park has a lot of amenities that will make your baseball experience amazing! If you’re visiting Baltimore during baseball season, make time to see a game.

Best baseball park in professional baseball. Great layout. It’s a blast to go to games. Tons of great food and drink. And they have a great kids package called dugout club that is reasonably priced and gets you access to 5 or so games a season plus discounted tickets for the adults. At these games, they have extra kid activities like balloons and face painting. Overall good old fashioned family fun.

This is such a gorgeous ball park. We’ve been traveling around to different ball parks and this was one of our favorites. The workers were so welcoming (even though we were in full Detroit Tigers gear), helpful, and taught us a lot about the park. Everything about the visit was wonderful. We loved it!!

name: Chesapeake Bay Maritime Museum
address: 213 N Talbot St, St Michaels, MD 21663, USA
reviews: This place is a treasure, and gets better every time I visit. The boats and the exhibits are wonderful, if not amazing, and they all tell a story about a place and time. The staff/docents are well informed, and only too happy to talk about the Bay, its boats, its people, and its history. Highly recommended. A must-see if you love wooden boats.

This is one of the most beautiful museums I have eve been to. Even though the day was cold we were able to really enjoy all the museum had to offer. We went up and explored in the lighthouse, played in the tugboat, and stepped back in time as we read the stories looked at the black and white photos on display.

It was a great and fun experience. The kids enjoyed their selves which as long as they can touch things and run around lol they tend to be content. Over all its a great place to learn about the bay and the history behind it. Its also a great way to learn about oysters, boats and other water life creatures. Also it was pretty cool watching a boat being built. Im not sure the price to get in the museum though we went on a class trip.

We were visiting from Ohio on a groupon deal and didn't know what to expect or what St. Michael's had to offer as far as things to see and do. We were so very impressed with this museum. When we set out to see it we thought it would be one big indoor building but instead there were a bunch of different buildings set up in a little village style. Everything was so informative and interactive with lots of personal stories. You were very much encouraged to interact with everything which you don't find in a lot of museums. It gave us a great appreciation for the Chesapeake Bay area and the people that made their livelihoods from the Bay. I would definitely recommend a stop there.
Lots of walking but lots of garden benches and places to sit & rest if you need to. Well maintained displays! Lots of history. And of course, the beautiful water. Great afternoon spent at the CBMM!

name: Live! Casino & Hotel
address: 7002 Arundel Mills Cir #7777, Hanover, MD 21076, USA
reviews: Attended a private event and got a "behind the scenes " tour of the special event space. What a great venue to host any size of event! No need to worry about adding fees for decor; it's already there! Got to see the dressing rooms for the entertainment and a look at the suite level. Very nice!!! The food was good too! And that doesn't cover the 10 restaurants on-site. If you haven't been there before, go check it out. For a concert, dinner, or gambling and an overnight stay. There's something for everyone.

I enjoyed the Casinos. It was a nice event for my son and I at his request. As a first time gambler, the Black Jack table, the associate was accommodating in helping me learn the tricks of the trade. He was nice and instructive on how to not touch the table and money while the game is in play. I won every game as a first timer. When my son returned and observed my winnings suggested we leave that table. The bathrooms were clean. It was a fun time.

Great new venue!

Had the privilege to see Jill Scott here, it sounded great and visually it looked stunning.

Bathrooms, seats and bars are all brand new and staff was very friendly, courteous and helpful.

Seats were a little bit expensive but that's the case for most acts today.

There is plenty of free parking in the garage or across the street.

We hit up Prime Rib before the show and I would also highly recommend grabbing dinner or drinks there before a show as well.

This casino has plenty of parking and is we'll lit on the outside. The inside is well taken care of. I have only been to an old casino and this is nicer than that one. I enjoy the poker room and they have good restaurants. It is also a nice facility to walk around and mingle. All the employees there are nice and professional. I would return.

Great casino!  Such a lovely place and the fact that it's non-smoking makes it 5 stars alone (don't worry smokers they have an area for you too!). Staff is very accommodating and friendly. Among the best casinos I've been to. Plenty of games and live tables. And all the restaurants inside are pretty solid as well. Highly recommended!

name: Baltimore Museum of Industry
reviews: There's so much to the industry of this famous port. Be sure to attend one of the guided tours. They will provide so much insight and original story telling. It's a real treat to have them demonstrate how some of the machinery works, too.

So interesting! My husband and I have been wanting to visit for a few years and we got a Saturday together without the kids so decided to finally check it out. I have to say, I’m glad we went without the kids. It was worth the wait. There’s a few things for kids to do but not really a whole lot and I would’ve been stressed out trying to keep my toddlers from touching all the things. Plus, it was fun to be able to take our time and really read everything with no distraction!
Super cool! My cousin had their wedding there and it was awesome! Being able to take a break from drinking and dancing to wall out on the docks was so great!

This was a wonderful experience. A beautifully curated collection of Maryland’s industry over the years. We were attended by two extremely kind and patient museum guides, I can’t thank them enough for their care of our little energetic troop of youngsters. Add this place to the top of your list for great family and educational fun.
Very interesting museum. Think it is better suited to bigger kids and adults. They did have a few activities that younger kids may enjoy.

name: National Mall
reviews: Absolutely love it here.  The architecture, the history, exhibits and sense of pride walking throughout is just incredible.  There are also tens and tens of local food trucks and many events that happen on a near weekly, if not daily, basis.  It's definitely worth visiting and seeing all of the things that the National Mall offers.

Wear good shoes bring a pair to change into. Bring powder for chub rub. Use the toilet, very few places to potty!
Love love love DC 
Plan your trips to see a little at a time. It's a lot to see in one day.
Personal favorite Spy Museum.

You can't go wrong visiting the National Mall.  You have all is the museums and monuments within walking distance.  So much history!  It's one of my favorite places to visit.  Best time to go is during the Cherry Blossoms in early spring.  You'll never see anything so beautiful.
I'll edit this post throughout the years to add photos.

I love the national mall. It is so great. All the memorials and monuments are spectacular and from a few places you can see the White House. If you can see all of the memorials and monuments they are beautiful. It is also an enjoyable place to walk. I highly recommend going up to the top of the Washington Monument.

Awesome place ! The whole mall is huge. It has a lot to see and most of it is free. Lots of monuments to appreciate and take pictures of. You really do walk a lot so be sure to bring comfortable shoes. Walking around could even get pretty romantic with your significant other, on any time of the day, but at night all the monuments are lit up and look really nice. Also, we always felt pretty safe when walking around. Just be careful around the subway exits, as sometimes there's suspicious people around.

There are museums for every taste, and most of them ( if not all) are free! Really enjoyed the Hirschhorn Museum, Natural history, and air and space! Should not miss those! 
There's also lots of great food places around, food trucks and restaurants.

name: The Maryland Zoo in Baltimore
reviews: Excellent zoo, our kids absolutely love it (and I do too!). A bit pricey, but you can tell they spend the money well -- animals are professionally cared for, and the facilities are in fantastic shape. Every staff member I've encountered has been friendly and helpful. You can do the whole thing in a day if you don't mind lots of walking, and it's well worth a visit if you're in Baltimore.

Love the Maryland Zoo, the staff was so friendly and knowledgeable. I loved seeing all the amazing animals, my personal favorite was the polar bear.  It was nice to have the tram near the entrance as I have a bad knee, it make getting from place to place so easy. Thank you for all your hard work to take care of these animals.  If I have any suggestions, it would be to allow for more affordable animal encounters, so I can see them up close, I dont mind paying a bit more!

I've been visiting the Maryland zoo since I was a child and it was called the Baltimore zoo. Changes of happened over the years including the name, but the mission itself and the quality with which they display the animals they tend to have not changed.

My kids love the Penguin area and the new elephant habitat especially, for the old staples are still pretty amazing also.This weekend my sister and I went and got to relive our past trips to the giraffe house while our kids were amazed by their beauty. Looking forward to returning soon!
It was a great experience. It was a nice day and most of the animals were easily visible!! The kids really enjoyed it. The only not so pleasant part was the wait on our food was almost an hour long.

The animals are all kinda spread apart so you'll have to walk a good distance before you can see the next animal.  They have a trolley to take you back to your car.  You'll need that bc its quite a nice long walk. They charge for entrance and its pretty pricey.  Overall,  nice zoo!

name: Sandy Point Shoal Lighthouse
address: Sandy Point State Park, 1100 College Pkwy E, Annapolis, MD 21409, USA
reviews: Ok lighthouse cruise.  It's 3 h long, and you see only 3 lighthouses and bay bridge. So there is a lot of time to eat or talk. Not much to see for this length of cruise.
Very cool to place to take photos of. Seems to always be under construction but with limited progress. Still, great place to look at from a boat.
Caught a bunch of rockfish here
20 inch rockfish allll day
Seanec place but no fish.

name: United States Botanic Garden
address: 100 Maryland Ave SW, Washington, DC 20001, USA
reviews: Our family really enjoyed the Botanical Gardens.  We went Thanksgiving week. It wasn't too crowded. The DC Landmarks made out of plants and plant products were really cool. The place is very well laid out and the plants and trees are beautiful, things are well labeled and easy to read. Our kids ages were from 3-12 and we all loved it. We are looking forward to go back in the spring to tour the outside gardens!

The green house in the Garden is massive and amazing. It truly gives the tropical feeling of warmth and comfort. Beautiful flowers and plants of colorful hues are spread all over the Garden. And the seasonal displays of the Holidays and the changing seasons are spectacular! A definite must for those who love to embrace the beauty of life!

A must visit. Especially around the Holidays. It was really empty on Christmas day when I visited, which made for a short line to get in. There's a stand with good coffee outside. Check out their exhibits, they do a really good job making art with plants. Also, I recommend reading the introductory signs next to the plans. Really interesting information.

Very nicely designed. A huge botanical field.
must-see...More green than the variety of colors I was expecting but it was still a really nice place to go.  Definitely worth walking through and wasn't that crowded for a Saturday before lunch time. Mini bazaars are fine looking coffee bar and cute gift shop: selling coffee travel mugs, appropriately, along with botanical logo print aprons and tea towels, scented candles, and so on!
