I told him she's not a service animal and that we had first asked for a seat outside but been told we could sit inside. He apologized and we moved outside. But the entire cafe saw this whole thing. It's a very small restaurant so they could see and hear it all. We were very embarrassed. Plus we has waited 20 minutes when we could have been seated right away if they listened to our request to be seated outside. It was just an unfortunate situation. The food was great and the staff was friendly during the encounter.

We decided to take a quick breakfast outing for the holiday and this place was fabulous. Truth in reporting, we have been here a few times. They are always on point with your order and they are quick. The quality of the food is exceptional and the customer service is outstanding! The customer service is key here. They are always friendly and aim to make sure that you are satisfied. Great job to this local business!

Sweet potato pancake was heavenly. Not too spice like some sweet potatoe dishes are. Ordered checked salad on rye and to my surprise it's on Marble Rye which is my favorite. Chips come with it and I added potatoe salad which is delicious so far. I love my carryout experience and will definitely be returning. My phone order taker/server was too cute!!

name: Mason's Famous Lobster Rolls
reviews: I came at lunch on a Tuesday around 1. There weren't many people in the restaurant, which was nice. I had the classic lobster roll and it was very good. I've had lobster rolls in Nantucket and this definitely competed with them. My roll had lots of lobster meat, the roll was fluffy and perfectly buttery. They don't overdress the lobster, which highlights it's deliciousness. I really like this Annapolis gem!

The Lobster Roll was delicious! As was the clam chowder and lobster bisque. The shrimp salad was ok, I wasn't a fan of the sauce they used on the shrimp. The place was small but quaint and the location was easy to find.

One of the best foods I had. Love the Lobster roll. Lobster tastes really delicious. The bun is also very soft and tasty. However, the portion size is a bit less. A little bit expensive. Compared with the taste, it worth the money. We have ordered two lobster rolls and a lobster salad. I prefer the Classic lobster roll than Connecticut lobster roll because the lobster in that is a bit warm and tasty. If you ever go to Annapolis, Mason's Famous Lobster Rolls is a must that you have.

It's a comfortable little spot wasn't very busy when I went it is very small not set up for a large group to eat in however you could always order it as carryout maybe pick it up and take it to your get together if you will, but I can tell you it's very good reasonable prices for what you get in perspective and consideration too. But definitely a go-to spot if you're into Lobster and warm cozy Seafood soups. They have lobster bisque all the way to clam chowder and everything is very good very fresh and very tasty. Check it out you'll be glad you did.🤙👍💯

This restaurant is pretty good for the food they have and the price! They don’t have that big of a menu, but the items that they do have, they do well! My dad got their classic lobster roll, which had a huge pile of lobster on a freshly toasted Texas toast piece of bread. He said it was delicious! Atmosphere is cute, and the service was really fast, but we were the only ones there at the moment, so not sure how the service would be if more people were there!

name: Blackwall Hitch
reviews: We were visiting the area for Independence Day weekend and decided to try Blackwall for dinner. We had an excellent server and they were very accommodating for our group of 11. We did make reservations. The restaurant has a very cool atmosphere and fits in really well with the neighborhood. The menu had a lot of great options and our entire group enjoyed their food! If we were here longer or if we come back to Annapolis I would definitely go back.

Brunch was a nice spread with lots of delicious choices. Crowd was nice. Definitely get there early and make a reservation. Never felt rushed and the waitress kept out glasses full. Definitely try the fried chicken.
Absolutely delicious and the service was awesome. Very friendly staff. Can't wait to go back!

Me and my fiancée came here today for Valentine’s Day for our first time ever to the restaurant and let me just say it was a phenomenal and fantastic experience. We have dined in a multitude of restaurants all over the DMV area and this by far has to be the most fantastic restaurant we have dined in so far. The service was phenomenal, we dined on the outdoor patio area which they had covered and provided a heater for since it is so chilly outside at the moment. They decorated the entire area in valentines themed decor, had a fantastic ambience and mood to the area, the music was fantastic. The food was beyond fantastic. Me and my fiancée got 2 completely different meal sets from the valentines menu and we were left in an awe. The taste, texture, smell, and design of the food was beyond fantastic. We had Cameron as our server and he did a beyond fantastic job as all the servers did, today was most likely a ridiculously busy day for them and they all held up very forward and happy despite the multitudes of people they had run through the place all day. We got to meet Sid(might have misspelled) and we were able to portray our happiness and overall feeling for the restaurant. Definitely a restaurant worth checking out, will be recommending all our family and friends and will definitely be back! Thank you all for an amazing night we won’t be forgetting! 😃😄

We really enjoy this place. The "Massive Mary" a top shelf tall Bloody Mary with spicy candied bacon, shrimp, crabmeat sandwich, pickles, celery, olives, lemon and lime slices and Old Bay rim was a meal in itself. The braised short rib is excellent.

name: Chris's Charcoal Pit
reviews:
If you are looking for real deal Greek cuisine in Annapolis - this is THE spot. 
Family owned and operated - 
Their specialty is their Gyro - which is awesome ... but everything else is great too. Try the baklava!
The staff is super friendly, attentive and accommodating 
They offer done in and carry out

I've been coming to Chris's since I was a kid in the 90s. It's got great food and great service! Get the athenian chicken or gyro platter, you cant go wrong. The pizzas are amazing, huge and delicious. The hot steak and cheese subs are also the best around. This place has seating inside for a group or you can get take out, I've done both and had great food either way.

My wife has a classic gyro platter, I had the chicken gyro platter. Best gyros we have had in years. Very hard to find an authentic Greek restaurant with quality food. They nailed it!
We are making this restaurant part of our routine.

So I've been craving a gyro for some time now but I live on the eastern shore of Maryland so I've not been able to satisfy that craving, many failed attempts however. 
Today however, thanks to Chris's I was able to satisfy that craving with a great Gyro. I think back to all the missed opportunities to eat here all the time I drove past and never considered stopping oh if i could just get that time back.  I can't wait to try other items off the menu now that I've found this place. 
Thanks Chris and great customer service also. 
I attached a photo but...I ate it all before I remembered to take a pic.

Awesome customer service!! Super friendly people!!!! Amazing food!!! Good place to go out and eat or carry out and eat Kid friendly definitely a family restaurant but could be an awesome date night too.

name: Tsunami
reviews: This is unquestionably one of the finest place to eat in the region. Whenever I come there I am extremely happy. They manage their very high  level service and the highest level of cooking  they offer. You surely will enjoy this this restaurant. Warmly  recommended.

Solid sushi, Asian-influenced food, and cocktails! Tsunami also has great happy hour deals - $8 cocktails and half off sushi rolls I believe. This place is also in general walking distance of a lot of great spots in the downtown area, which makes it a great spot to eat and then hit the town afterwards. 

Downside is this place quickly fills up, making it hard to get a table. Come early or try to make a reservation! 

#tsunami #sushi #cocktails #Asianfood #misosoup
Fantastic takeout experience. No contact, super fast. Quality of sushi still top notch. Staff super friendly.
An awesome spot where all us industry folk love to come grab a drink and socialize. Can't go wrong with sushi at midnight and delicious cocktails. And always the best company.
Best sushi I have had.  Happy hour is very affordable and the staff and attentive and work hard.  We went out with a friend for his birthday and it was excellent.

name: Basmati Indian Restaurant
address: 2444 Solomons Island Rd, Annapolis, MD 21401, USA
reviews: My favorite restaurant! The food is delicious, so amazing! Super healthy and full of Ayurvedic herbs as well!!! I’m vegan and always have lots to eat. The staff are so sweet. I love everyone that works there. Basmati is the best 😊😊😊 been going since they opened, and love them so much.
My first Indian restaurant experience. The food was absolutely amazing and the service was great. My favorite was the butter chicken.

Yesterday was the first time we visited this magnificent restaurant. But It is absolutely not the last. We passed a splendid evening with the attentive service, with the superb  meal and booze and with the friendly payment. We will definitely come back in a short time.

This spot is the one I like best. I go to many restaurants but here I  constantly return again and again. The team is very warm and the food they serve is so delicious. I never decline to have a decent meal in this place. I recommend this place with pleasure.

Good price......and very good Indian cuisine with just the right amount of heat.  Staff was very attentive, unusual for a buffet.  If you like something different for a lunch outing, definitely try Basmati...

name: Light House Bistro
reviews: I saw the Light House Bistro on the map and was intrigued by their story so I decided to try them for dinner.  I was not disappointed.   I tried one of their specialty cocktails and selected the shrimp pappardelle as an entree.  It was served piping hot with four jumbo shrimp and pappardelle pasta in a cream sauce that included bacon.  It was very filling.   For dessert I picked the caramel apple tart with vanilla ice cream.  It's not a conventional apple tart that you might think of.  If was more like a deconstructed tart, in my opinion, but it was still tasty.  The pastry was light and flaky and the apples where thinly shaved in a caramel sauce.  Overall I give five stars for the Light House Bistro and recommend them for dinner.

We came here to celebrate my birthday this year. Everyone really liked their food and the guy serving our table was extremely personable and patient. He provided quick service and checked on us often. I ordered a filet of halibut and the seat on it was fantastic. We will be back.

Amazing! The food here is delicious! I had the Breakfast Nachos for brunch...yummy! Great serving sizes. The service was fantastic. We will be coming back soon!

I am editing my review. I went here on 2/16/20 and today, 2/18/20 I see that the waitress charged my credit card twice. I called and left a message for the manager...we will see if anything is resolved!
Outstanding food, Service, atmosphere! After spending many years overseas and now back in the Annapolis area, this was 1 of 2 outstanding restaurants at which we have eaten. Thank you! excellent!
What a fantastic place! Great food, greater service! So wonderful to be able to help folks get back on their feet and enjoy a delicious meal at the same time.

name: Wild Country Seafood
address: 124 Bay Shore Ave, Annapolis, MD 21403, USA
reviews: I often take my friends to this restaurant with my highest recommendations. I go their often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The dishes they serve are yummy and the crew is attentive and cooperative. Every time  we go to this place we have a pleasant time.  highly recommended.
Loved it! Food was so delicious, loved sitting at the picnic tables on a sunny day. Great hush puppies.

Wife was very happy with her soft shelled crab. My rockfish was good. Service is not fast but didn't worry us because the seafood is fresh! Everything clearly cooked after we ordered it. 5 or 6 outside picnic benches, plus 3-4 bar stools inside.
Delicious crab, quaint accomodations, friendly people. A real local feel in the heart of Annapolis (east)!
THE freshest local seafood in town. Limited seating and all outside.

name: Gordon Biersch Brewery Restaurant
address: 1906 Towne Centre Blvd #155, Annapolis, MD 21401, USA
reviews:
Gordon Biersch is a safe choice in a world of inconsistent dining experienced. Trust that, here  your beer will always be served to you cold and in a glass.....
Trust that your entree will be flavorful and cooked to order...
Trust that your dessert will be able to serve 2 and will worth the extra 2000 calories....
This location officers a variety of seating options from outdoor, booth, high chair table, and bar chair.
You will feel welcome, satisfied, and safe,.....and if you are lucky....maybe your waiter will take a step beyond and make you feel like a valued community member and not just a patron...

Fantastic place, Great Staff, Great BEER, Great Food!  Also a great VALUE-- you get a LOT for your $$, especially during Happy Hour [2-7pm M-F]!  Kid-friendly (yes, they have high-chairs), and they have an amazing way to satisfy sports-fans (watching games in the Bar area) without ruining the dining experience for those in the Dining area!

I ordered via one of the food delivery services and was mildly pleased about the salad I received. In the food delivery service's app, the salad name is listed as Gorgonzola Pear Salad. It also contains crusted checked that was more plentiful than the pear that is featured in the title. The dressing was very fitting but the lack of pear can be seen in the attached photo. Would order again but I'll make sure that I ask if more pear is an option.

Love their shrimp tacos! Upgraded to delicious sweet potato fries. 
Bbq burger and black & blue were cooked perfectly. Garlic fries are made with fresh garlic and it shows. Beer selections are always great.

Great beer, food, and service.

I recommend the Marzen beer and chicken schnitzel. The salmon is good also.

They sell growlers that you may have filled for consumption at home. I recommend this if you're super hungry and looking for a fresh, heavy dinner out with friends.

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House
reviews: My husband and I went here for the first time tonight. We decided to treat ourselves and try somewhere different. The food was amazing. The lobster mac and cheese was our favorite part, the spicy shrimp appetizer was also a hit! The steak was great, of course. The drinks were good and the dessert just really finished off a great meal. I can't remember our waiter's name, but he was very friendly and knowledgeable. His recommendations did not disappoint.

Really enjoyed our dining experience this evening. The service and food were great as I expect from Ruth's Chris. The dining area is up a flight of stairs so it was a bit of a challenge with my new left knee and bum right hip. They do have dining on the ground level but you have to request it. Who knew? The hostess was professional but she could be a bit more engaging and personable. I like the complimentary valet parking. Just tip the valet when he brings your car. All in all an enjoyable experience.

Ronnie was a good server. Great smile and pours a Guinness(and wine) well.  Ambiance was wonderful. But my husband's steak was very overdone and they didn't have the wine in stock that we had selected. Our server did a great job handling both issues, but I do expect better from a Ruth's Chris.

Stephanie & Jeff were the absolute best service while at Ruth Chris. They made sure everything was absolutely perfect for us. The food was AMAZING! And the sweet Potato casserole was our favorite thing on the menu!! We will definitely be back. Thank you so much Stephanie and Jeff!!! You guys are the BEST!!

This was our first time at this location and it was well worth the money. Everything was cooked perfectly and our waiter was outstanding.  From the appetizers to the desserts, I highly recommend this place when you are looking for a great dinner.

name: Middleton Tavern
reviews: I had two appetizers, crab ball slider, two the size of meatballs, taste was typical and good, but much smaller than slider bun. But for $5, it's what you get.  Also tasted the oyster shooters, came with double shot of beer.  They were huge and tasty.  I will come back and try something else

We sat on the outside eating mussels on a nice sunny day and it was wonderful. We had the mussel appetizer and it was a huge plate of mussels for just $12 and they were delicious. I also had the smoked brisket sandwich for $12 and it was delicious. I would highly recommend eating here! Prices and food were great, outdoor venue was excellent.

Very popular brunch place right next to the water. The food is really good. We got the french toast filled with creme cheese and covered in fruits. Coffee is not that good, but it's unlimited refills. Sit down outside for the beat experience. Average brunch price is $35 for two
.
Famous dish here is mussels (very Irish dish), a place with long history in a historic building

The food was okay The service was good and the price was high. You have to take in consideration you're on the water and you're in a tourist area and this is a tourist type of restaurant. I would recommend it for first timer I don't know if I would make it a regular state of affairs but I definitely enjoyed my first time and I will say they tried their best.

name: Nano Asian Dining
reviews: We had 4 kinds of sushi. Teriyaki chicken, shrimp and veggies tempura for dinner. Everything tasted great. Tempura is very light and crispy. Staffs are super friendly. Very clean place.

This restaurant is my preferred one. I eat in plenty of restaurants but here I go the most. The team is very friendly and the cooking they place on your table is so good. I would always prefer to have a decent dinner here. I recommend this place with pleasure.
Being vegan, lots of great menu choices from rolls to tofu wraps to tempura. Loved every bite!
We love eating here! My girlfriend and I eat at Nano once a week. Ling and the rest of the staff are excellent. The food is hot and fresh. Price is right also.
Lunch was great. However I was more impressed by very clean windows... Seriously :) since we were sitting at the bar spot next to it we could truly enjoy the view :)

name: Reynolds Tavern and 1747 Pub
reviews:
My absolute go to place when it comes to afternoon tea! (*Actually booking a reservation for tomorrow after I'm done writing this review.🙂*)

•The staff is so friendly here! 
•The service is also always fantastic whenever we visit, and never had to wait a long time at all for food or drinks to arrive.
•The environment is absolutely stunning. We've dined in both rooms multiple times and I always enjoy taking photos of things in each room, but always seems like there's more to take photos of each visit here. :)
•The food and tea never disappoints! The Cherry chocolate chip scones are so decadent and amazing, and Cupid's Arrow is my absolute favorite tea to have here.

I can't recommend Reynolds enough!
Down in the pub it's a very colonial atmosphere but with some great beer. And other spirits, of course.  Wish the TVs were gone but oh, well.  Staff is great.

Took our mom there for a belated celebration.  She enjoyed it. Bo, our waitstaff person was tremendous in explaining the menu. We chose The Colonial Tea which was really a fine choice for mom as she likes small plates of food and she enjoys teas. The Apple Tea she chose was flavorful. The brown sugar lumps took a minute or two to get used to but it was a part of the treat. Our thirteen year old niece found it "different" but very enjoyable. She will try it again which says a lot for a young person. We had the Cream of Crab. I had the Shrimp with Bacon soup which I thoroughly enjoyed. It was very flavorful and the vegetables were plentiful. Everyone in my group of four enjoyed their meal; we will do it again.  The Reynolds atmosphere is great way of stepping back in time and the atmosphere was very relaxing.

Visited Reynolds Tavern for tea and found the atmosphere to be fascinating historically and certainly unique, but the wooden tables in the dining rooms are very small and unstable as are the chairs. The dining rooms are also very small, which is to be expected in an historic home, but there are too many tables and chairs, that make both movement through the rooms and seating very challenging. 

The waitresses and the other patrons were constantly excusing themselves to avoid bumping into each other both as they were serving tables, seated at their tables, and as they attempted to move through the room.

The food portions in the tea service are unbelievably small and surprisingly limited. A single small scone per person, tea sandwiches that are child-size, and pastries measuring literally less than ½ inch square. All of this would be absolutely fine but the cost for the customer is shockingly exorbitant and in no way worth the experience you are offered.

We stayed for a weekend during the Fish for a Cure Event downtown.  Convenient location, great price, beautiful rooms and a very nice light breakfast.  The tavern downstairs is a must visit for history buffs, and beer garden is the perfect place to end the evening... awesome!  
Wes & Marilyn are fantastic hosts.

name: Joss Café & Sushi Bar
reviews: Delicious sushi .. fantastic service - in the heart of downtown Annapolis. Great spot for a date or casual meal. Check out their great lunch specials

Joss has lost its flare. We call to place an order. We are informed that you can only order online (although the website says otherwise). We are having internet issues. We call back. Sorry, we are to.d, we will have to figure it out. The site isn’t working on our Mac. Sorry we cannot help you. Our phones work so we order from there. Slightly confused why they cannot help a customer trying her hardest to order from them. The food was sub-par. We have been coming to this restaurant for over 20 years but this may have been our last time.  The rice was some odd kind, not the usual. The chicken was way overcooked and leathery not to mention half the usual portion. The fish tasted, well, fishy. Not good.

I eat in this lovely place quite a bit! This is my favorite restaurant to grab a bite.  I visit this place many times. The cooking is very good, the crew is courteous and the prices are affordable. I like eating in this restaurant for a rich meal.

Everything was fabulous:
Eel roll with avocado 
Soft shell crab app
Dumplings
Blue fin tuna sashimi 
And our server, Cindy(?), was exceptional! She knew the menu through and through and answered all our questions. Her recommendations were on point!
HIGHLY recommend this place. 
It does get busy. We were smart and ate an early dinner. ;)
Our server was amazing! Always on top of refilling our drinks and such. The food was amazing at around the same price as other places around DTA. SUPER IMPRESSED AND WILL BE COMING BACK

name: Chick & Ruth's Delly
reviews: Not exactly fine dining, but the food is fast and good. The service could have been better the last time that I came, but I've been coming here for years so I don't really expect a whole lot from them.

Absolutely disgusting! Cockroaches and flies are falling in the corners and along a crease of the walls under the tables. The pickles that you order at the table and come in a small bowl are amazing. However!!! Whatever is left in the pickles you ordered and you ate with your fingers are put in boxes and sent 2 pick up or delivery. So if you don't mind that this place is great it seems like this place is protected because politicians get sandwiches named after themselves and got free food. Not always but there's a lot going on there. The food is mediocre at best and you can smell the stale oil always and you know what scent it is if you have worked in that industry. It's really amazing this place is still in business. Just look in the corners on the floor under the tables you will find them.

Great food, great pie. Century old ambience. Popular place. Wait staff diffident but competent. 
Somewhat crowded two floors with narrow stairs.
Will go back. Pols from statehouse were holding meeting. Apparently everyone in Annapolis knows of this place. Parking garage, free around corner thirty steps away.  Park there to walk to Statehouse,  then to wharf to see statuary of Alex Haley and surrounding info on 'Roots.' Finally, (tho I didn't go) fifty steps away is Naval Academy, which everyone says is excellent experience. Only three block back to car. But, MANY great things to see and do in Annapolis.

My first time visiting this cute, little "Ma & Pa" establishment and apparently it’s been the cornerstone of Annapolis, MD since 1965! Some have quoted it as “the-squeeze-'em-in-tight” type Delly but boy do they knock out an affordable, big menu! Heavy on sandwiches and breakfast plates. Visitors can relive grade-school days reciting the Pledge of Allegiance at 8:30am weekdays and 9:30am Saturday and Sunday. Breakfast is served all day. 

I’m in love with the COLOSSAL CRAB CAKES! Look at these things! Let me just say that driving an hour from Baltimore for a taste of these lump crab beauties is worth the trip. Til next time Chick & Ruth’s, which can’t come soon enough.

So first off, it's definitely worth noting that their "20oz" milkshakes are not 20 ounces.  Closer to 32 I'd say.  They fill your glass, then give you the remainder of the shake to fill it to the top once again.

Such a cool little place overall.  I didn't get around to trying one of their famous crab cakes, but their burger sure didn't disappoint.  The names are awesome on the menu options.  Wait staff is very personable and clearly have appreciation for their unique place of employment.

name: Giolitti Delicatessen
reviews: This restaurant is my favorite place.  Of all restaurants I know I like it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to visit this place. everytime  I feel like having a decent meal, this is the place that comes straightaway to my mind. splendid and   food and a rich menu.trained team, and great spirit. In addition to that, the price is modest. I tell about this spot with no hesitation.

What a gem!  Very quaint place with excellent food.  I got take out but there are tables if you want to stay.  They have a great selection of baked goods and other grocery items you might not be able to find elsewhere. I uploaded a couple of photos.  The Calzone was phenomenal, and the sauce was to die for - plus, it was warm.  A lot of places give you a small ramekin of cold sauce, but not Giolitti's.  I was visiting from out of town so I was very happy to find it.

Oh my goodness, the food was EXCELLENT! Had the Porchetta sandwich and a side order of Antipasto salad, it was divine. The salad had little kick to it and the sandwich was so good. Not dry and not soggy either. If ever in the area again I would definitely stop and have lunch here again. They also have a selection of wines, pastas and breads.

First time here, and both the food and customer service were excellent. The prosciutto and fresh mozzarella were incredible. Definitely will be back and would highly recommend to anyone looking for a great Italian Deli in the area.
Good food and service.

name: Jack's Fortune
address: 960 Bay Ridge Rd, Annapolis, MD 21403, USA
reviews: Always delicious fresh food, no MSG, friendly staff and good prices!
Food is amazing I eat there all the time. The owner and her son's are always extremely nice and pleasant to be around. No complaints.
Excellent Chinese cuisine! A tidy, neat, clean restaurant with a delicious menu. Very warm and hospitable environment. Highly recommend it 😊👍

This was my first time ordering from Jack's Fortune.  I had heard great thing about Jack's Fortune and drove 25 minutes for take-out.  Bottom line, I loved it.  The time between ordering and receiving my meals was ten minutes max, and may have been less.  The food was fantastic and most importantly fresh, which is unlike the many resturants in my area.

I can't know who else, if anyone, might care about this, but Jack's Kung Pao chicken is made in a brown sauce (instead of white/clear which seems prevalent hereabouts). I am always hoping to find restaurants that make it this way, as I find it far more enjoyable.

name: MISSION BBQ
reviews: This is an amazing restaurant. AMAZING service. The cashier gave my grandmother a free dessert because she was cute, she said. The food is phenomenal, very much recommend the pulled pork sandwich with fries. The location cannot be beat; it is right by the water in historic Annapolis.  It is one of the places I'm truly proud to be an American.

Visited here on a recent overnight in Annapolis, really friendly staff and amazing food!! I had the baby back ribs, fries and cornbread and highly recommend them!! The rub on the ribs was a bit intense for me, but was delicious!! Tried the Kansas City and Texas sauces, both incredible

I had a great meal here. I had a gift card that was 2 years old, why was downtown decided to check it out I'm glad I did I will be coming back again. And I will recommend this to my friends, and will probably bring them with me the beer was good too to really set the taste of the brisket I enjoyed so much
Excellent spot to grab something when in a hurry. Their customer service is quick, pricing is reasonable, awesome mood. I highly recommend this place
Love the atmosphere and the staff. Had the Texas Inspired Chopped Brisket Sandwich with Baked Beans and Mac n Cheese and it was pretty darn good!  I would defiantly come back.

name: Yama Sushi Bar
address: 2049 West St E, Annapolis, MD 21401, USA
reviews: First visit was definitely a great one. They have soy paper and green tea cheesecake. Very impressed. Each person I encountered was pleasant and helpful. Ambiance is beautiful, decor is soothing and order was beautiful. I'll be back as this was a most impressive dining experience even for take out. UPDATE - Max and Joel are my favorite servers so far. Both remembered me from prior visits. You really can't beat the lunchbox special as it is filling and money saving.
My first visit was exceptional. The best customer service in the area!! Reasonable prices and delicious sushi. This is my new favorite restaurant.

This place is doubtless one of the most attractive restaurants in the area. Whenever I go there I am highly satisfied. They maintain their high  standard service and the topmost level of food  they offer. You are always happy with this restaurant. Warmly  recommended.
Fast service and good food. Price is Right at normal for the area. Plus, excellently polite servers.

Great food. Very friendly knowledgeable staff our waitress was wonderful. Atmosphere was very cozy and personable. The dinosaur egg is fantastic a must try. I live about 15 miles away but I have found my new sushi joint

name: Bread and Butter Kitchen
address: 303 Second St A, Annapolis, MD 21403, USA
reviews: Very tasty food, beautiful view, and the staff is very nice. The owner Monica does a lot of wonderful things for the community which is part of why I like to patronize this business. It is a win win.

Such a great place for lunch right on the water in Annapolis. You can tell they make their food fresh and it tastes great. I had the BBK Burger my first time and the Philly Cheesesteak my second time and everything was delicious. Definitely coming back here when I’m in Annapolis.

This place is a hidden treasure. Food was amazing. Decorated darling inside making the most of no space. Ate outside overlooking the dock while in the shade. 
Service was wonderful. Outside was very dog friendly. Scones were the best I've ever had. (Light, fluffy, not over iced, used real fresh blueberries and baked to perfection) 
Iced coffee was actually coffee, iced, with frozen coffee cubes while you doctor to your liking. (No prefab liquids) 
You need to try it!
Super good food and super great staff. It’s small and has a little bit of a DIY vibe. Great location.

Amazingly good food and the staff are friendly and nice. Great view of the water and there's outdoor seating. Always try the soup(s) of the day and their daily specials are almost always their best item on that day. Try the Chicken Chipotle Panini -- probably the best thing on their regular lunch menu.

name: Little Italy Annapolis
address: 1411 Forest Dr b, Annapolis, MD 21403, USA
reviews:
Happened to be near this place, on business.
Man....I am SO GLAD that I came here!
DEEEEEEEEELISH!!!!!
I got a really simple dish of sausage, peppers and onions, over spaghetti. It was remarkably good. One of the best I've ever had!
Nice staff. Quick service. And...again...
delicious food!
Well done Little Italy!!!
Tasty Italian fare with really great service. Comfortable atmosphere, very friendly neighborhood kind of vibe.

This place in fantastic!  We’ve been going there since they opened the doors.  The food, service, everything is incredible.  We have even ordered an item that was not on the menu (something my son orders at a different Italian restaurant), and they said “no problem” and made it for him...many times.  I highly recommend trying out Little Italy in Annapolis.
Wow! Went here for lunch, the pizza & wings are amazing! I highly recommend this place.

I really wanted to try Little Italy, I read the reviews and thought ok great but it wasn’t what I expected, I’m really disappointed I called to place my order they said 20 minutes but it turned out to be 40 minutes for what? a BURNT and very GREASE pizza, wasn’t great at all, not worth it at all.

name: Carlson's Donuts & Thai Kitchen
reviews: It was delicious. People are so friendly over there. I ordered a papaya salad which was fantastic. You must try their noodle soup with beef. I will definitely come back.
Intriguing combination... We came for dinner and it was fantastic. Then decided to come back the next morning for donuts. Also delish! Come early and bring cash.
Awsome thai food

Went there for breakfast. Sandwich was kind of greasy. Donut was good. Unfortunately service was non-existent. The lady at the counter was not exactly friendly. Just point to the coffee table when I ask for my coffee. Seems to be very annoyed at me. 

1 week later:
Stop by for Dinner, Thai food..
Love the drunken noodles, crispy duck was dry and tasteless, sauteed shrimp dish was ok. 

So 3.5 stars ..

More updates 2/28/20
Don't come here during dinner hour, have to wait 30 mins before they bring you water. Only 1 waitress/owner .. 1 hour before getting the meal. Sigh. Slow.

Tom yum soup is just sour with out the taste. I will skip that next time.
favorite thai place, everything always tastes great. waiter is very nice and accommodating of requests and modifications. we even got some free donuts for dessert after dinner :)

name: Davis' Pub
reviews: Great American Pub. Great food. Great ambiance. Great service. I thoroughly enjoyed their pulled bbq sandwich and chicken noodle soup. I can't wait to go back soon.

This small locals hangout takes me back to hanging out on the Jersey Shore. Lots of friendly people. The food is killer. The pretzel crab appetizer is awesome. The BBQ sandwich is really good and the thin cut French fries, which many places don't serve, complete the meal. Go and spend some time, meet new people and have a great meal.
They go the extra mile. Thank you for making my quarantine anniversary a fun one!

Best neighborhood pub ever! Immediately greeted after arrival, and then the server/bartender made sure she/he got my name and told me their name. Remembered my drink during several repeat visits (I have been here for lunch approximately 12 times). The menu changes daily - I tried their Reuben, fish sandwich, hamburgers, and several specials  -all were very good and well made, good proportions.

I agree with the favorable reviews. Good service, good food, cold beer, provided in a clean environment with occasional waterfront dinning, due to climate change.  Crab cake sandwich was great. Visiting Yankees may want to request a toasted roll to firm the bite,and get the 5 star rating. The Maryland crab soup was a home run too. Well done!

name: Dock Street Bar & Grill
reviews:
Best crab cake place in annapolis.
Staff is attentive, and provide a fast service.
Food was on point and really good. Both wife and I enjoy this place every time we are in Annapolis.

The food here is excellent. The 1 pound of steamed shrimp I has was almost more than I could eat. Compared to other restaurants nearby like next door on either side there is no comparison! Dock street is almost always very crowded but no other restaurant nearby compares and you'll like the prices!
Had some of the best wings! Burgers were perfect! Great service!  Will be back again.
Had the tuna, the crab dip and the chicken tenders. Everything was amazing.  The staff is so friendly and the environment is very welcoming.
Best Crab Cakes in Maryland!! Even at 1am when the place is packed on a Saturday night! When in Annapolis make sure to stop by here for good food and service.

name: McGarvey's Saloon & Oyster Bar
reviews: Calamari, blackened fish tacos, crab cakes, asparagus and the fish of the day (flounder) were all great. Excellent tarter sauce. The cocktail sauce is pretty sweet. The salsa with the tacos is spicy and good. I wish I would have taken pics because the plates looked so nice. Our server was super friendly and she encouraged the crab cake which I was very happy with.

We came from KCMO on a vacation for 5 days. We ate here twice. The first time we came the food and service was absolutely wonderful! The crab soup was awesome. The oysters were delicious! We got the special on them the $.50 each. The second time we came my shrimp and grits had a piece of plastic in it. I let the server know just to give them a heads up. The manager came over and asked if I wanted another one. I obviously didn't want the same because I was afraid it would happen again. I had only had a few bites. It was delicious what I had of it though. They ended up giving us a drink.  Better than nothing,but normally you would take off that meal or maybe discount it at least. I also had the crab soup and noticed second night it had lots of shells in it. The house brew is really good and house shandy is delicious.

This place is supppper cool. They have a TREE in the restaurant. That is amazing. The waiter was nice (Didn't catch his name, but you know who you are if you are reading this review) was really nice and helpful. The Stuffed Shrimp was really great. Shrimp with crab? Yes please, Wrapped in BACON? Oh yes. I didn't get it, but i stole some from my grandma, and it was really great. Fish and chips were also really flavorful and good. Decor, was also, amazing because THERE IS A TREE IN THE RESTAURANT. It is also much larger than you think it is. When I first came, it was PACKED in the front room, and I thought 'We're never gonna get a table." But then, they had a whole other room, which was really great.

Before a Navy basketball game, we had dinner at McGarvey's sitting at a table in the front bar room. Classic, cozy bar where patrons were talking and having fun, and half the people seemed to know the bartender. At least that evening, this was an authentic "neighborhood bar". Yes, I had a couple pints of the Aviator Lager (good) and I had an enormous bacon bbq burger. It all seemed made to order, the burger was hand-formed and bacon was big and just cooked. We will definitely be back!
Nice spot for some good beers and seafood.  The food is pretty decent for pub food. Tasty and perfect mix for the beers.
